text: Robert Habeck (born 2 September 1969 in Lübeck) is a German writer and politician. Habeck was the Vice-Chancellor of Germany and Federal Minister for Economic Affairs and Climate Action from December 2021 until May 2025. He is a member of the Alliance '90/The Greens and was their co-leader from 2018 until 2022. Habeck was the Deputy Prime Minister and State Minister for Energy, Agriculture, Environment and Rural Areas in the Albig Cabinet and in the Cabinet Günther.Homepage des Ministeriums für Energiewende, Landwirtschaft, Umwelt und ländliche Räume SH Under his leadership, the Green Party became the third largest group in the Landtag after the 2017 state elections.CDU siegt im Norden - Schlappe für SPD Tagesschau, 5 May 2017. ==References== Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Writers from Schleswig-Holstein Category:Politicians of Alliance '90/The Greens Category:Vice Chancellors of Germany Category:Economy ministers of Germany Category:members of the German Bundestag Category:politicians from Schleswig-Holstein Category:People from Lübeck
title: Robert Habeck
